oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cover page for W. W. Fergusson's "War Memories, " Engineer Corps, P.A.C.S.
War Memories, Engineer Corps, P.A.C.S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cover page of "War Memories" by W. W. Fergusson featuring calligraphied, stylized text for the title and hand-drawn, hand-colored Confederate and Federal flags. Description provided by the Tennessee State Library & Archives.

William Wallace Fergusson was born in 1831. In 1861, he joined the Second Tennessee Regiment called the Sumner Greys and mustered into Conferderate service. He served at Shiloh and Chattanooga. He left service in May 1865 and returned to Smith County. He married Medora Kerby in 1866 and opened Blackgnat Academy at Riddleton which stayed in operation until the 1890s. He died in 1922. Civil War engineers built roads and bridges, planned defenses and prepared maps. Historical note provided by the Tennessee State Library & Archives.
